metadata.Title: CVE-2020-1751 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1751` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc-bin - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-amd64 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-armel - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-i386 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-pic - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-s390 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
libc6-x32 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
locales - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
locales-all - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
multiarch-support - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
nscd - 2.27-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> -esm releases only supports amd64 arch mdeslaur> introduced in https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=d400dcac5e

criterions.comment: glibc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.27-3ubuntu1.2').
